headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; THE RESTELL FELONY CASE. Meeting of the Board of Education. THE PAVONIA FERRY LEASE SOLD AT AUCTION. Poultry Show--List of Premiums. THE ELECTION OF CHIEF ENGINEER. HARBOR ENCROACHMENTS. FIRE IN ROOSEVELT STREET.

docs.lead_paragraph: Postponement of the Investigation-Severe Illness of the Complainant--Cordella A. Grant--Incidents. Yesterday afternoon, at the hour appointed for the investigation of the charge of felony preferred against Madame RESTELL and GEORGE R. SHACKFORD, by CORDELLA A. GRANT, the Jefferson Market Court-room was crowded with persons, anxious to ascertain the particulars of the affair

headline.main: LATER FROM HAVANA.; The Postal Arrangements. Progress of the Africanization Scheme, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: As there is some misapprehension in relation to our recently-established prohibitory postage, I beg to state that the law does not apply to matter going out of Cuba, in the shape of periodicals.
docs.snippet: As there is some misapprehension in relation to our recently-established prohibitory postage, I beg to state that the law does not apply to matter going out of Cuba, in the shape of periodicals.

byline.original: SPECIAL CORRESPONDENCE OF THE N. Y. DAILY TIMES

headline.main: Improper Sewerage and the City Docks.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: I have looked forward with considerable interest for the report published in to-day's paper, respecting encroachments on the harbor of New-York, and respectfully request the favor of making a few remarks on one particular subject connected with it, through your columns.

headline.main: Meeting of the Board of Governors.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Governors of the Almshouse held a regular meeting at the Rotunda, yesterday afternoon--present, Governors Draper, Smith, Duke, Townsend, Pinckney, Dagro, Henry, Herrick: the President, Governor DRAPER, in the Chair.
docs.snippet: The Governors of the Almshouse held a regular meeting at the Rotunda, yesterday afternoon--present, Governors Draper, Smith, Duke, Townsend, Pinckney, Dagro, Henry, Herrick: the President, Governor DRAPER, in the Chair.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Alleged Murder Two Years Ago--Paul Ritter Discharged--Remarks of the Magistrate. SOCIETY OF UNIVERSAL DEMOCRATIC REPUBLICANS. THE ALBANY-STREET PETITION AGAIN. GEOGRAPHICAL AND STATISTICAL SOCIETY THE NATIONAL POULTRY SHOW. KILLED ON SHIPBOARD. COURT CALENDAR--WEDNESDAY.

docs.lead_paragraph: BEFORE JUDGE STUART. The examination respecting the murder of an aged citizen named WM. FURLONG, in the month of March, 1852, was resumed yesterday before Justice STUART. The defendants, REED and RITTER, who stand charged with the perpetration of the awful crime, were arraigned, and WASHINGTON SECOR was further examined, as follows, by the Justice:
